{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.15576v1", "title": "Reply to Comment on 'Product states and Schmidt rank of mutually
  unbiased bases in dimension six'", "summary": "Daniel McNulty $et.al$ \cite{commentMUB} voiced suspicions to the Lemma 11(v)
Part 6 in \cite{Chen2017Product} and three theorems derived in later
publications \cite{Liang2019,lma2020,xyc}. For these suspicions, we reprove
that any $6\times 6$ complex Hadamard matrix whose number of real elements more
than 22 does not belong to a set of four mutually unbiased bases. We show that
the number of $2\times 2$ complex Hadamard submatrices of any $H_2$-reducible
matrix is not $10,...,16,18$. We also put forward some possible directions for
further development.", "main_category": "quant-ph", "categories": "quant-ph", "published": "2025-04-22T04:20:58Z"}
